artifacts.summary: Analysis of Phase 1 bridge lemma blockage: 6 sorries in mcs_world_truth_correspondence are unrecoverable due to architectural mismatch in model construction

partial_progress.details: Research complete. Bridge lemma approach found to be architecturally flawed for modal/temporal operators. Recommended pivot to contrapositive approach using existing semantic_weak_completeness.

sorries_locations: Line 255: forward box - universal quantification over non-MCS states
Line 262: h_box_in_S - cannot extract MCS membership from semantic truth
Line 273: forward all_future - constant history loses temporal structure
Line 278: backward all_future - needs indexed MCS family
Line 283: all_past - same issues as all_future
findings.root_cause: Architectural mismatch: model has all FiniteWorldStates but needs only MCS-derived ones for modal truth; constant history loses temporal structure
findings.alternative_path: Use semantic_weak_completeness contrapositive for consistency-to-satisfiability instead of direct model construction

immediate: Abandon current bridge lemma approach in ConsistentSatisfiable.lean
Fix FiniteStrongCompleteness.lean syntax errors (references non-existent semantic_completeness)
Revise implementation plan to use contrapositive approach
recommendations.path_forward: Infinitary completeness achievable via: semantic_weak_completeness -> consistent_implies_satisfiable (contrapositive) -> infinitary_strong_completeness -> compactness
